title: The Control Performance podcast series
description: A typical plant is losing millions annually from poorly-performing control systems.  Typically, 20-30% of controls are in manual mode.  Up to 85% of control loops have sub-optimal settings.  20-40% of controllers are oscillating, adding to plant variability, and hurting reliability.  With so many issues, it can be hard to monitor, prioritize, and resolve issues.

title: The Esports Report
description:
The Esports Report is a podcast focusing on American High School Esports programs. The hosts, Ashley Hodge and Wil Nix, both started as Season 0 Esports coaches through the PlayVS Georgia Esports program. Wil Nix has experienced significant success with his program by winning the Georgia State Championship for Rocket League, and he serves on the GHSA Esports Board of Advisors. Ashley Hodge serves as a PlayVS Supercoach, A member of the GHSA Esports Board of Advisors, and a member of Riot’s Scholastic Association of America. She has created two successful esports programs in Georgia. Additionally, she is currently working on a esports dissertation. 


The goal of this podcast is to educate admins, students, parents, schools, and society about esports in American high schools. Topics include the following: a history of esports in GA, how to start a program, how to fund a program, how to coach, how to manage social media accounts, how to grow your program, and much more. Furthermore, several interviews with GHSA, PlayVS, coaches, students, and players are planned for future episodes. 

Please engage with us by leaving comments on the Youtube episodes, rating and reviewing us on Apple Podcast, and emailing us at theesportsreporths@gmail.com 

If you are a business or potential sponsor, we would love to do promotions for you. Your contribution will help cover the cost of editing software used and other expenses to make this show possible. Please contact us for ad rates at our email listed above.

title: SCI Science Perspectives
description:
The American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) brings you SCI Science Perspectives. The podcast is built around two-part dialogues with spinal cord injury (SCI) professionals regarding their emerging scientific work spanning the full spectrum of SCI research, from discovery to clinical application. 

The SCI Science Perspectives podcast disseminates the latest-and-greatest scientific work in the SCI field via a conversation with researchers that approaches their work from two perspectives: the “scholarly” perspective and the “community” perspective. The process begins with ASIA’s Committees informing the podcast about new and influential scientific papers relevant to the committee’s interests. Then the podcast host(s) then interview the author(s) of the papers, approaching their project from each perspective. Finally, the conversation from each perspective is published as its own episode type: "Scholarly" and "Community" episodes. Keep an eye out too for "Admin" episodes too, communicating administrative information relevant to ASIA members and stakeholders.

Ik zet me er graag voor in. Ik wil graag samen verder komen er gebeurd veel en er staat veel te gebeuren in en rond onze branche. Personeel (met namen monteurs) en winkels verdwijnen. Als klant wil je gewoon graag geholpen worden door een monteur die je fiets kan maken. Dat hij het probleem oplost waar en wanneer jij dat wil.

Het online platform voor fietsend Nederland fietsreparatie.nu de ideale match tussen de fietser en de fietsenmaker en een online leeromgeving. Veel instrcutie, uitleg en gereedschap video's vindt je op ons YouTube kanaal vraagdefietsenmaker

title: Lab Talk LIVE!
description:
Join our hosts, Dr. Nichole Thompson and Charisse Stokes, as they have candid conversations on entrepreneurship, technology, innovation, and how these industries are growing are diversifying. 

Recorded live from The Lab on Dexter, this podcast was born on one of the most historical streets in the nation: Dexter Avenue. A stone’s throw from the Alabama Capitol, The Lab is located at the crossroads of our nation’s civil and human rights journey. 

Dr. Nichole Thompson is a serial entrepreneur with a proven track record for launching successful startups both domestically and internationally. She is the founder of She Wins Global, a nonprofit organization that works to advance women and girls in marginalized and vulnerable communities across the globe, and is the founder and co-owner of AdaChic Designs, a socially conscious handbag company that supports entrepreneurs across Africa. She earned her Doctorate degree in Educational Leadership and has also served in several senior administrative roles, including the role of Chief Diversity Officer. She’s co-authored multiple publications and has received numerous awards heralding her ability to thrust organizations to their next envisioned state. 

Charisse Stokes is president of Tidal IT Solutions, LLC, an information technology consulting company in Montgomery, Alabama, a position she has held since 2017.  In this role, she supports government and commercial industry clients by providing tech, innovation, and business development consulting services.  She holds a bachelor of science degree in Ceramic Engineering from Clemson University and a master of business administration in Finance from Auburn University Montgomery. She previously served in a variety of leadership roles in the United States Air Force and for small business information technology firms managing multiple, large-scale IT projects worldwide.  She currently serves on the board of Alabama Power Company; in addition to roles on the Business Council of Alabama,  Alabama STEM Advisory Council, Computer Science Task Force, and the Armed Forces Communication and Electronics Association (AFCEA) International, AUM College of Business, Trenholm State Community College Computer Information Systems and Saint James School Boards. As the past Director of the Education Foundation for the Montgomery AFCEA Chapter which provided STEM initiatives to the local community, she founded EduWerx, a nonprofit organization exposing minorities and young women to STEM.  Her greatest joy is spending time with her son, Dylan.

title: The Chameleons Podcast
description:
The world as we know is changing fast. We are experiencing a technological shift with an enormous potential for advances in knowledge and solutions for individuals and society. This requires extraordinary human agency and ability to adjust to the changes and navigate this unknown territory together. This is why this podcast is called The Chameleons – as a tribute to our incredibly malleable nature.

Host Imac Zambrana is seeking input from a group of international and Norwegian experts and advocates from tech-relevant fields concerning their thoughts about the potential of different interplays between technology, individuals, and societies. These conversations about real and fictional meetings between human and machine in the past, present, and future, are an invitation to reflect on how we can adjust for what might, what will, and what might never come.

Language: English & Norwegian (depending on the native language of the guests).

Music by: Håkon Onsager.

Graphics by: Øivin Horvei.

Guest Relationship Advisor: Nicole Patrice De Member

Welcome to "The Wakeup Call," the podcast that brings essential tech insights to enhance your business, bolster your internet security awareness, and develop solid cybersecurity hygiene, especially in developing countries like Uganda. Join us as we delve into the world of technology and uncover practical tips to empower your digital journey.

Summary of Content Presented

  • Business Growth in a Digital Age: Learn how to leverage technology to foster business growth and stay competitive in the ever-evolving market. We discuss various tools, resources, and best practices to maximize your online presence and reach a broader audience.

  • Internet Security Awareness: Protecting your digital assets and personal information is crucial in today's connected world. Tune in to discover essential internet security practices and how to safeguard your data from cyber threats.

  • Building Solid Cybersecurity Hygiene in Uganda: In a developing country like Uganda, where digital infrastructure is rapidly growing, establishing strong cybersecurity practices is vital. Our experts share insights into understanding potential risks and adopting proactive measures to ensure a safer digital environment.

We love hearing from our audience! Share your thoughts, questions, and suggestions with us. Connect with us on Facebook /muyanjafred256, and be part of the tech discussion.

Subscribe to "The Wakeup Call" on your favorite podcast platform to stay up-to-date with the latest tech insights and interviews in each episode, one at a time.

Stay tuned for our next episode, where we will continue to explore fascinating tech topics that can shape your future. Until then, keep exploring, stay curious, and stay safe online!

Welcome to 'Eye on AI', your audio compass guiding you through the intricate maze of Artificial Intelligence. As you tune in, you'll embark on an auditory journey that delves deep beneath the surface of AI, shedding light on the brilliance of its innovations and the dilemmas it presents.

Have you ever marveled at how Siri or Alexa understands your commands, or pondered how your Netflix recommendations are so spot on? How about the algorithm that tailors your social media feed, making you lose track of time? It's all a result of the magic weaved by AI—a blend of mathematics, programming, and often, sheer genius.

But AI isn't just about algorithms or technological innovations. It's also about the challenges it presents, the ethical tightropes it has us treading, and the sociopolitical implications it carries. As machines become increasingly intelligent, surpassing human abilities in various fields, where does this leave us—the original thinkers? 'Eye on AI' doesn't shy away from these tough questions. Instead, it invites them, fostering a platform where we can discuss, debate, and decipher the larger implications of this tech phenomenon.

From the latest breakthroughs that have scholars buzzing to real-world applications that touch our everyday lives, we’ll uncover it all. And it's not just for the tech-savvy. Whether you're an AI aficionado or just curious about that voice inside your GPS, we aim to make AI approachable, understandable, and exciting for all.

So, if you've ever been intrigued by how AI is reshaping industries, from healthcare to finance, or if you've pondered what the future might look like in an AI-dominated world, this podcast is your ticket. We promise captivating conversations, intriguing insights, and perhaps, a new way to look at the digital world around you.

Join us, as we embark on this voyage, charting the vast ocean of Artificial Intelligence, a realm where possibilities are endless and the future is now. Subscribe and become a fellow explorer of the AI frontier, navigating its wonders and challenges together. Welcome aboard 'Eye on AI', where every episode promises a deeper understanding of the world's most transformative technology.

title: Innovation Nation
description:
Innovation Nation Podcast tries to help Micro and Small businesses overcome common business challenges by interviewing other owners and CEO's of innovative companies.

By shedding light on solutions, we want to empower entrepreneurs, and MSMEs, with the tools to be successful.

title: Tech Stories
description: I have 20+ years of experience in the tech industry. Having worked at giant companies as well as startups with a handful of employees, sometimes doing a side-hustle just to pay the bills. There are so many stories to tell about the people, companies and products. What are some of the new innovations that are coming down the line. Let's have engaging conversations and maybe talk to a few thought leaders as well.

title: Autotune Me: Play, Unwind, Repeat
description:
Welcome to the Autotune Me Podcast.

In this podcast, Dr. Kendra Ray and her guests unravel the creative arts therapies and their influence on the brain and memory. Each month, a featured interview will highlight how music, dance, and the arts have played a vital role in the lives of people from suffering from memory disorders as well as their friends and families. Follow us at autotuneme.org.
